          <article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><h1 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-wordpress-memento-plugin" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#wordpress-memento-plugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>wordpress-memento-plugin</h1>
<p dir="auto">A plugin for Wordpress web sites to enable the Memento framework for time-based access</p>
<p dir="auto">This is a work in progress and should not be expected to work.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://travis-ci.org/pastpages/wordpress-memento-plugin" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/9618b0f0f8a9de440ad8393178c7d9310914f6286bc69ce2264217faeb809669/68747470733a2f2f7472617669732d63692e6f72672f7061737470616765732f776f726470726573732d6d656d656e746f2d706c7567696e2e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="Build Status" data-canonical-src="https://travis-ci.org/pastpages/wordpress-memento-plugin.svg?branch=master" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Testing: <a href="https://travis-ci.org/pastpages/wordpress-memento-plugin" rel="nofollow">travis-ci.org/pastpages/wordpress-memento-plugin</a></li>
</ul>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-installation-from-source-code" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#installation-from-source-code"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Installation from source code</h2>
<p dir="auto">Install the system requirements.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ sudo apt-get install php5 php5-dev php-pear phpunit"><pre>$ sudo apt-get install php5 php5-dev php-pear phpunit</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Install Wordpress and its dependencies, however you might like. Here's <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-install-wordpress-on-ubuntu-14-04" rel="nofollow">one guide</a>.</p>
<p dir="auto">Clone this repository on your computer.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ git clone https://github.com/pastpages/wordpress-memento-plugin.git"><pre>$ git clone https://github.com/pastpages/wordpress-memento-plugin.git</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Jump into the directory.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ cd wordpress-memento-plugin"><pre>$ <span class="pl-c1">cd</span> wordpress-memento-plugin</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Create a symbolic link between the source code and the plugin directory in
your local Wordpress installation.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ ln -s `pwd`/memento/ /path-to-your-wordpress/wp-content/plugins/memento"><pre>$ ln -s <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">`</span>pwd<span class="pl-pds">`</span></span>/memento/ /path-to-your-wordpress/wp-content/plugins/memento</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Open up the administration panel of your local Wordpress installation and you
should see Memento among the installed plugins.</p>
<h2 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-running-tests" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#running-tests"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Running tests</h2>
<p dir="auto">Unittests are written for <code>phpunit</code> and executed like so:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ make test"><pre>$ make <span class="pl-c1">test</span></pre></div>
</article>

readabilityObject.title: GitHub - palewire/wordpress-memento-plugin: A plugin for Wordpress web sites to enable the Memento framework for time-based access
readabilityObject.content:
A plugin for Wordpress web sites to enable the Memento framework for time-based access

This is a work in progress and should not be expected to work.

  • Testing: travis-ci.org/pastpages/wordpress-memento-plugin

Installation from source code

Install the system requirements.

$ sudo apt-get install php5 php5-dev php-pear phpunit

Install Wordpress and its dependencies, however you might like. Here's one guide.

Clone this repository on your computer.

$ git clone https://github.com/pastpages/wordpress-memento-plugin.git

Jump into the directory.

$ cd wordpress-memento-plugin

Create a symbolic link between the source code and the plugin directory in your local Wordpress installation.

$ ln -s `pwd`/memento/ /path-to-your-wordpress/wp-content/plugins/memento

Open up the administration panel of your local Wordpress installation and you should see Memento among the installed plugins.

Running tests

Unittests are written for phpunit and executed like so:
